did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Institute for Comparative and Environmental Toxicology records. 1978-2005.

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Cornell University. Institute for Comparative and Environmental Toxicology.

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Includes reports, publications, correspondence and proposals concerning research on Superfunds, the toxicology training program, the Cornell University Program in Comparative and Environmental Toxicology (CUPCET), the outreach/educational branch of ICET, and the corporate associates program.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The Institute for Comparative and Environment Toxicology (ICET), was founded in 1981 to support the Graduate Field of Environmental and Biochemical Toxicology. In 1992 it became a unit in the Cornell Center for the Environment, which closed in 2008. It is now housed in the Dept. of Food Science in the College of Agriculture and Life Sciences.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Includes reports, publications, correspondence and proposals concerning research on Superfunds, the toxicology training program, the Cornell University Program in Comparative and Environmental Toxicology (CUPCET), the outreach/educational branch of ICET, and the corporate associates program.

prefercite.p: Institute for Comparative and Environmental Toxicology Records, #21-50-4038. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Early History of Cornell University Program in Comparative and Environmental Toxicology (CUPCET) and the Institute for Comparative and Environmental Toxicology (CET), including correspondence, reports, proposals, corporate foundation relation files and curriculum development records
Continued curriculum/teaching records, faculty publications and reports, Superfund files, grants, symposiums/workshops
